A 52-year-old photographer from Little Rock, Ark., |Mr. McDermott| may be the *Ansel Adams* of /Angkor/.
author: Gross, Matt

text: (''LeftyHenry,'' a recent poster on a political blog, was less subtle in his criticism; he called |Payne| ''the *Hitler* of /American academics/.'')
author: Tough, Paul

text: |Mr. Gonzales| is the *Michael Brown* of /the Justice Department/, smilingly presiding over incompetence, chaos and malfeasance, while President Bush insists that he is doing a heck of a job.

|Denis Leary| would seem an unlikely candidate to become the *Dick Wolf* of /dark/, morally muddied TV series about firefighters, cops and lawyers -- and perhaps no more so than on a morning last week on an Upper East Side playground.
Aldo called |it| the *Arnold Schwarzenegger* of /zweigelts/, and not coincidentally it was the most expensive zweigelt in the tasting, at $28.

We'll have to wait to see if |David Chase|, the *Garbo* of /goombahs/ now pursued by a feral beast of disappointed ''Sopranos'' fans, is feeling as paranoid and thin-skinned as the two Tonys, and as deeply surprised by the consequences of his actions.
author: Dowd, Maureen

text: (|She| is billed as the *Simon Cowell* of /matchmaking/.)

So it's not surprising that |Simon Schama|, a Columbia University professor, is turning into the *Bob Barker* of /art criticism/, a genial television host who excitedly invites viewers to come on down to high culture.
Time magazine once nicknamed |him| ''the *Paul Revere* of /the environmental movement/.''
